overview:
Chris loves data. Prior to Clever Sense, he used his powers for science at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory while working on the BaBar experiment. He was responsible for the development and implementation of machine learning and data mining techniques used for extracting extremely rare physics events from extremely large datasets. Now he uses his powers for contextual-discovery to develop scalable solutions in the area of unstructured web data mining.

Chris received his Ph.D. in Physics from The University of Texas in 2008 and holds a B.S. in Mathematics and Physics from The University of Arkansas
